channel.title: multiplayer/campaign ideas
channel.description: what about after the release *whenever that is* they work on a multiplayer version? with custom modes, for instance maybe something like gears of war 3's beast mode, or left 4 deads versus mode? like playing as monsters and fighting humans? or maybe they could make an entirely different campaign where you play as something? And what about just some fun gamemodes? like TF2's slag server

item.title: multiplayer/campaign ideas

item.description:
Also, why can’t they change their clothes within their dormitories?

item.title: multiplayer/campaign ideas
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
vitek245:

Hello This screenshot shows us how people “go” to work already in working smocks. They should change clothes in their lockers. I think you understand what I mean

You mean they should model a bunch of different plain-clothes characters that would only be seen at a distance during the opening sequence & never be used again?
Do I need to explain why that’s a bad idea or should I tell you why it’s in the wrong topic? (And the word you’re looking for is labcoats, not smocks)

Read full topic

item.title: multiplayer/campaign ideas
item.dc:creator: Eli_Vance
item.description:
Power_Dust:

This is a recreation of Half-Life but nothing more. I am certain that there are projects that take care of the seven hour war but not this one.

But… but… but… since when did multiplayer have to be canon? Yes, it’s a remake of Half-Life, but it’s a remake of Deathmatch, too, and there’s no reason there shouldn’t be references to events mentioned in other games in it. Unless they’re being loyal like that. :meh:

Read full topic

item.description:
Hey, what about some mode set in the Seven Hour War? Like, Black Mesa: Aftermath. Endless waves of combines (models from HL2, natch) coming right at you, ending when the citadel arrives, and the scores are tallied.

item.title: multiplayer/campaign ideas
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
I’m totally fine with DM/TDM when we get MP, but I would love to see custom modes for this by the community.

A hl “zombie survival” mode in black mesa, where one team is HEV suits and the other is Xen, and that team starts out with 1 headcrab would be pretty cool. You’d have to pick off a guy, then you’d take control of his body, and the guy would respawn as a headcrab, until you got enough to start advancing to another alien stage. Humans could have a tech tree for the weapons, so the longer you stay alive the better the weapons you get, with experimentals like gluon and gauss being later on. To spice it up you could even throw a HECU team into the mix, but that would probably be much harder to balance.

Read full topic

item.title: multiplayer/campaign ideas
item.dc:creator: Nerdguy
item.description:
Develop & Assault: Both team needs to finish an incomplete map & weapons with textures, sounds, codes, & models scattered around the map (like power-ups) and delay the opposing team’s progress

Each team starts with an under powered crowbar that needs codes to function properly
Other weapons starts with either wrong/no sounds, textures, codes, models that need to be collected around the map for them to function properly (fire an incomplete mp5 and an error pops up and disconnect you from the server)

The map have non-functional areas ,water, ladder, buttons, etc. which have the same requirements as the weapons, but collected differently (there’s texture for each map props and weapons & wander to an unfinished area for too long and the same error pops up)

Each team’s have a self-destruct button deep inside the heavily protected base that cannot function until the other team have completed “developing” all the weapons and the map (which will make the button functional)
The first team that destroys the enemy base wins

Read full topic

item.title: multiplayer/campaign ideas
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Awaiting Authorization: Both team’s bases have a missile silo, and have to collect signed authorization forms to launch their missile the opposing team’s base.
It would work kinda like King of the hill.
